Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2013 05:34AM - edited Feb 5, 2013 05:37AM by netty46 Yes I read this also. I was thinking of double Masectomy and actually wanted it. My docs kept saying no and just ignoring me. I then learned cancer likes to come to breast most of time so best to keep them I was told. I know a lady in jersey who recurred 7 times. Every time to the breast. Finally after that they diid double Masectomy.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy carries lower overall survival Afraid Momine

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2012 05:18PM netty46 wrote: Hi Everyone : My world is crashing down. I just found out local recurrence. I got the call 2 hours ago. My breast was full of necrosis, calififications, junk. He went Monday and now he calls that its a high grade 3cm that was found amongs all this.  Let me tell you all I had a Diep Flap in this breast in 2005. Anyone has this experience?  what will be done?  The did a Stat Cat Scan on me Before surgery and that did not even show cancer.  Chest was clear and no swollen nodes.  I am walking around like a zombie. Helpppppppppp  My 1st was 2000 stage 1.6cm grade 3 had lumpectomy , radiation, and CMF chemo. Diep Flap perfomed 2005. 2 year ago I had pathology on this breast.  I had a mammo just now March 7th.

Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with triple negative invasive ducal cancer faynmoc terrilynn

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2013 10:06AM netty46 wrote: Fay do not let the triple negative scare you. I was diagnosed in 2000 was fine for 12 yrs it came back to same breast. I went 12 yrs with no scans at all after five years not much bloods except for mammos. Because it was never spoken of i was not worried. Think of it as breast cancer and that's it. When it just came back I was devastated beyond control. I have read alot on this site. Her2+ and er,pr+ is just about the same. So focus on getting better not the TN.

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2013 09:58AM netty46 wrote: Mine was kinda different I wanted lumpectomy immediately so tumor was removed then I did chemo. But my new surgeons still wanted to go back in to remove tissue down deep, to make sure margins were clear, and to do the snb , also to make sure this was not on ribs or anywhere that would signify a chest wall recurrence since they were not sure. MRI before surgery was clear but they still wanted too see with thier eyes. They kept the skin from my tummy. Since this recurred in a reconstructed breast. MRI before surgery is a good tool. At that point my surgeon was almost sure no nodes were affected or nearby muscles.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy- Should skin be removed at biopsy site? Recurrence. CJ425 Liz1973
